request.content:
The trainee will demonstrate proficiency in basic seamanship.

Chapter 3: Line Handling

When handling mooring lines, always be aware of the snap-back zone. Lines under tension can part without warning and cause serious injury or death.

To secure a line to a cleat, first pass the line around the base, then make figure-eight turns, and finish with a half-hitch on the last turn. Practice this procedure until you can do it confidently.
